news.title: Ahmedabad builder pays ₹103.5 crore for additional FSI to construct 38-storey highrise in Thaltej
news.para: A builder paid a record Rs 103.50 crore for additional FSI to construct a 38-storey residential project, signaling a surge in luxury high-rise demand. This significant approval, driven by high jantri rates and relaxed norms, will see four towers with heights up to 127.7m, offering 250 units.

news.title: Bhopal now ceding realty projects ground to Ujjain: Madhya Pradesh RERA report
news.para: Major real estate projects are shifting from Bhopal to Ujjain, the Chief Minister's hometown, with Ujjain now registering more projects than the state capital. Builders cite the upcoming Ujjain Simhastha and the CM's connection as reasons, while Bhopal's development is hampered by an outdated master plan. Indore remains the leading city for project registrations.

news.title: China Vanke bondholders reject payment extension, raising default risk
news.para: China Vanke's bondholders have rejected a crucial extension request, elevating the company's risk of default. This development ignites fresh fears regarding the stability of the country’s property industry. With 2 billion yuan at stake and a limited grace period looming, Vanke's efforts to secure credit-enhanced proposals also failed to garner support.

news.title: China's home prices slide further in November
news.para: China's housing market is grappling with persistent sluggishness, as evidenced by a decline in new home prices throughout November. This trend, deepening from prior downturns, makes it clear that the appetite for property is still low, despite governmental commitments to foster stability.

news.title: Odisha govt notifies amendments to stamp rules, will help streamline property valuation
news.para: Odisha has updated its stamp duty rules to ensure fairer property valuations and boost transparency. New guidelines will use plot-wise market data and average auction prices in cities, moving away from inflated figures. Property values will be revised every two years, with urban areas seeing a 5% increase annually. Building valuations will now consider construction stage and materials used.

news.title: Pune: NGT allows construction at Baner project, but orders monitoring by MPCB
news.para: The National Green Tribunal has permitted construction to resume at a Baner real estate project, mandating Maharashtra Pollution Control Board (MPCB) monitoring for noise and dust pollution. The MPCB will assess the site within a week and determine if past violations warrant environmental damage compensation, while the Pune Municipal Corporation must establish construction pollution protocols.

news.title: NDMC launches cleanliness drive across key residential, commercial zones
news.para: The New Delhi Municipal Council is igniting a transformation with its latest cleanliness campaign. Different departments are uniting efforts to sweep away dust, remove silt, and elevate the beauty of green areas. This initiative specifically targets high-traffic residential and commercial zones, striving to minimize pollution and improve public health.

news.title: No permit fee for small plots in Uttar Pradesh
news.para: Uttar Pradesh government has waived building permit and inspection fees for residential plots under 1,076 sqft and small shops under 323 sqft. Amended byelaws now grant deemed approval for construction on these plots via an online platform. Revisions also broaden definitions of floor area ratio and layout plans, promoting vertical growth and updating building descriptions.

news.title: Odisha REAT upholds ORERA order requiring builder to obtain OC, transfer common areas
news.para: OREAT has ruled against a city realtor's challenge to an ORERA order, highlighting the importance of compliance in real estate development. The tribunal has required the promoter to secure completion and occupancy certificates for the 41-duplex project located in Janla.

news.title: Pride Hotels targets IPO by March 2026 to fund renovations
news.para: Pride Hotels is gearing up for an IPO scheduled for March 2026, fueling its ambition to revamp its existing properties while also focusing on debt reduction. This strategic move aligns with its plan to broaden its reach by launching new hotels in key business areas, popular leisure destinations, and spiritual hubs.

news.title: Builders delaying EWS, LIG flats? Ghaziabad development body sets up panel to look into it
news.para: A six-member committee has been formed to investigate delays by private developers in allotting EWS and LIG residential units in Ghaziabad.  Complaints indicate developers are not providing possession to beneficiaries as mandated. The committee will submit a zone-wise report, and erring developers may face map approval cancellation.

news.title: Mumbai civic body conducts lottery draw for 426 houses
news.para: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation held an online draw for 426 homes.  373 applicants were successful in securing housing.  Another 362 applicants have been placed on a waiting list.    A further lottery for 296 residential units is planned soon.

news.title: Residents claim builder flouting construction norms in Bengaluru
news.para: Residents of a Bengaluru gated community are experiencing severe disruption due to ongoing construction noise, often extending beyond permissible hours. Despite repeated complaints and a 2012 Karnataka High Court order limiting noisy work to 8 am-6 pm, authorities and police appear unable to enforce the regulations, leaving residents stressed and sleep-deprived.

news.title: Mumbai: BMC issues stop-work notice to Prestige Towers for flouting air pollution norms
news.para: Mumbai's BMC has halted work at Prestige Towers for flouting pollution rules, including inadequate site barricades and water spraying.  Across the G-South ward, 30 such notices were issued recently.  Activists urge the MPCB to increase its city presence and suggest a dedicated Mumbai board.  Navi Mumbai's NMMC also issued 18 stop-work orders for similar violations.

news.title: Six restaurants sealed for operating without BU approval in Ahmedabad
news.para: Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation is cracking down on illegal establishments, sealing six restaurants and cafes in the West Zone for operating without Building Use permission and Fire NOC. Popular eateries in Gota, Thaltej, and Bodakdev were among those shut down. The AMC also fined two construction sites for safety violations, emphasizing its commitment to enforcing regulations.

news.title: Chandigarh administration estimates and plans optimal use of available land for future development
news.para: Chandigarh faces a land crunch with less than 10% remaining for expansion. The UT administration is mapping all vacant and earmarked plots for housing, commercial, and institutional use to optimize land utilization. Major land parcels are available in Phase III and the IT Park, with further development planned in peripheral areas.

news.title: Six illegal constructions sealed in Jaipur's Adarsh Nagar zone
news.para: Jaipur Municipal Corporation sealed six illegal constructions in Adarsh Nagar zone during a special drive. The action targeted unauthorized commercial establishments and plots found without mandatory approvals. Officials emphasized the importance of obtaining proper permissions to prevent disruptions and safety risks.

news.title: Maharashtra grants legal status to digitally signed land records
news.para: Maharashtra has granted full legal status to digitally signed land records, including 7/12 and 8-A extracts, and property cards. This move is expected to significantly reduce lending risks and speed up land verification cycles, improving capital allocation in the real estate market. The policy aims to enhance transparency and confidence for investors and developers.

news.title: Ludhiana civic bodu's Dhandhari C&D waste plant operational but starved of waste
news.para: Ludhiana's long-awaited construction and demolition waste processing plant is finally operational but faces a critical shortage of incoming waste. Despite overcoming numerous hurdles, the plant is underutilized as waste isn't reaching the site. Civic officials are now scrambling to establish new designated dumping points across the city to ensure a steady supply and combat illegal dumping.

news.title: Nagpur: Probe ordered after allegations of scam over slum rehabilitating project
news.para: Industries Minister Uday Samant announced a 30-day inquiry into alleged scam involving BMC officials in Marol's Kondivita slum rehabilitation for road widening. Shiv Sena (UBT) MLC Anil Parab accused Assistant Municipal Commissioner Nitin Shukla and two engineers of duping slum dwellers to favour builders. Officials found involved will face dismissal.
